Description: Water bottle of grey earthenware with a strainer in the neck.
Curator's comments: The Slip records this as "bought by Cureton", which enables this to be identified as part of the large group 1848,0308.1 to 62 of early Egyptian antiquities that were purchased on the BM's behalf by the dealer Harry Osborn Cureton at an auction in London. It must have been separated from the rest of the group as being modern Egyptian rather than ancient.
